modules.description: This module implements the L-BFGS-B optimization algorithm using C-layout bigarrays for efficient numerical computations. It provides `min` and `max` functions to optimize differentiable functions with optional bound constraints, supporting callbacks for printing, stopping conditions, and workspace management. Typical use cases include minimizing or maximizing objective functions in machine learning, physics simulations, or financial models where gradient-based optimization is required.

This module implements the L-BFGS-B optimization algorithm for minimizing or maximizing a differentiable function given as a vector-to-scalar function with gradient. It operates on Fortran-layout Bigarrays representing vectors, and supports bound constraints on variables. It is suitable for large-scale optimization problems in machine learning, numerical analysis, or parameter estimation where memory is limited.
